snippet: President Obama and other world leaders expressed anger at the beheading of James Foley by ISIS, which released a video, as Britain investigated if the killer in the video was a British citizen.
abstract: Pres Obama and other world leaders express outrage over beheading of reporter James Foley by Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; video released of execution is seen as significant because it is first official threat coming from ISIS directly addressing America and Americans; Britain is investigating if the killer in the video is a British citizen.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura contributed reporting from London, and Alison Smale from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: President Obama and other world leaders expressed anger at the beheading of James Foley by ISIS, which released a video, as Britain investigated if the killer in the video was a British citizen.

headline.main: Leaders Express Outrage as Britain Tries to Identify Beheaded Journalist’s Killer
headline.print_headline: Leaders Express Outrage as Britain Tries to Identify Beheaded Journalist’s Killer

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
